label: chapter=12, username=liang12e
title: Chapter 12 Exception Handling and Text I/O

questions.text:
The following code causes Java to throw _________.

int number = Integer.MAX_VALUE + 1;

What exception type does the following program throw?

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    System.out.println(1 / 0);
  }
}
A Java exception is an instance of __________.
An instance of _________ describes system errors. If this type of error occurs, there is little you can do beyond notifying the user and trying to terminate the program gracefully.
An instance of _________ describes the errors caused by your program and external circumstances. These errors can be caught and handled by your program.
Instances of _________ are unchecked exceptions. Please select all that apply.

What exception type does the following program throw?

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    int[] list = new int[5];
    System.out.println(list[5]);
  }
}

What exception type does the following program throw?

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    String s = "abc";
    System.out.println(s.charAt(3));
  }
}
A method must declare to throw ________.

What exception type does the following program throw?

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    Object o = null;
    System.out.println(o.toString());
  }
}

What exception type does the following program throw?

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    Object o = null;
    System.out.println(o);
  }
}
Which of the following statements are true? Please select all that apply.

choices.label: A
choices.text: You use the keyword throws to declare exceptions in the method heading.

choices.label: B
choices.text: A method may declare multiple exceptions to be thrown.

choices.label: C
choices.text: To throw an exception, use the key word throw.

choices.label: D
choices.text: If a checked exception occurs in a method, it must be either caught or declared to be thrown from the method.

questions.text:
Analyze the following code:

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) throws MyException {
    System.out.println("Welcome to Java");
  }
}

class MyException extends Error {
}

choices.label: A
choices.text: You should not declare a class that extends Error, because Error raises a fatal error that terminates the program.

choices.label: B
choices.text: You cannot declare an exception in the main method.

choices.label: C
choices.text: You declared an exception in the main method, but you did not throw it.

choices.label: D
choices.text: The program has a compile error.

questions.text:
What exception type does the following program throw?

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    Object o = new Object();
    String d = (String)o;
  }
}

Analyze the following code:

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    try {
      String s = "5.6";
      Integer.parseInt(s); // Cause a NumberFormatException

      int i = 0;
      int y = 2 / i;
    }
    catch (Exception ex) {
      System.out.println("NumberFormatException");
    }
    catch (RuntimeException ex) {
      System.out.println("RuntimeException");
    }
  }
}

choices.label: C
choices.text: The program displays NumberFormatException followed by RuntimeException.

choices.label: D
choices.text: The program has a compile error.

questions.text: An instance of _________ describes programming errors, such as bad casting, accessing an out-of-bounds array, and numeric errors.

Analyze the following program.

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    try {
      String s = "5.6";
      Integer.parseInt(s); // Cause a NumberFormatException

      int i = 0;
      int y = 2 / i;
      System.out.println("Welcome to Java");
    }
    catch (Exception ex) {
      System.out.println(ex);
    }
  }
}

choices.label: A
choices.text: An exception is raised due to Integer.parseInt(s);

choices.label: B
choices.text: An exception is raised due to 2 / i;

choices.label: C
choices.text: The program has a compile error.

choices.label: D
choices.text: The program compiles and runs without exceptions.

questions.text:
What is displayed on the console when running the following program?

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    try {
      p();
      System.out.println("After the method call");
    }
    catch (NumberFormatException ex) {
      System.out.println("NumberFormatException");
    }
    catch (RuntimeException ex) {
      System.out.println("RuntimeException");
    }
  }

  static void p() {
    String s = "5.6";
    Integer.parseInt(s); // Cause a NumberFormatException

    int i = 0;
    int y = 2 / i;
    System.out.println("Welcome to Java");
  }
}

choices.label: B
choices.text: The program displays NumberFormatException followed by After the method call.

choices.label: C
choices.text: The program displays NumberFormatException followed by RuntimeException.

choices.label: D
choices.text: The program has a compile error.

questions.text:
What is displayed on the console when running the following program?

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    try {
      p();
      System.out.println("After the method call");
    }
    catch (RuntimeException ex) {
      System.out.println("RuntimeException");
    }
    catch (Exception ex) {
      System.out.println("Exception");
    }
  }

  static void p() throws Exception {
    try {
      String s = "5.6";
      Integer.parseInt(s); // Cause a NumberFormatException

      int i = 0;
      int y = 2 / i;
      System.out.println("Welcome to Java");
    }
    catch (RuntimeException ex) {
      System.out.println("RuntimeException");
    }
    catch (Exception ex) {
      System.out.println("Exception");
    }
  }
}

choices.label: C
choices.text: The program displays RuntimeException followed by After the method call.

choices.label: D
choices.text: The program displays Exception followed by RuntimeException.

choices.label: E
choices.text: The program has a compile error.

questions.text:
What is wrong in the following program?

public class Test {
  public static void main (String[] args) {
    try {
      System.out.println("Welcome to Java");
     }
  }
}

choices.label: A
choices.text: You cannot have a try block without a catch block.

choices.label: B
choices.text: You cannot have a try block without a catch block or a finally block.

choices.label: C
choices.text: A method call that does not declare exceptions cannot be placed inside a try block.

questions.text:
What is displayed on the console when running the following program?

public class Test {
  public static void main (String[] args) {
    try {
      System.out.println("Welcome to Java");
    }
    finally {
      System.out.println("The finally clause is executed");
    }
  }
}

choices.label: B
choices.text: Welcome to Java followed by The finally clause is executed in the next line

questions.text:
What is displayed on the console when running the following program?

public class Test {
  public static void main (String[] args) {
    try {
      System.out.println("Welcome to Java");
      return;
    }
    finally {
      System.out.println("The finally clause is executed");
    }
  }
}

choices.label: B
choices.text: Welcome to Java followed by The finally clause is executed in the next line

questions.text:
What is displayed on the console when running the following program?

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    try {
      System.out.println("Welcome to Java");
      int i = 0;
      int y = 2 / i;
      System.out.println("Welcome to HTML");
    }
    finally {
      System.out.println("The finally clause is executed");
    }
  }
}

choices.label: A
choices.text: Welcome to Java, then an error message.

choices.label: B
choices.text: Welcome to Java followed by The finally clause is executed in the next line, then an error message.

choices.label: C
choices.text: The program displays three lines: Welcome to Java, Welcome to HTML, The finally clause is executed, then an error message.

questions.text:
What is displayed on the console when running the following program?

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    try {
      System.out.println("Welcome to Java");
      int i = 0;
      double y = 2.0 / i;
      System.out.println("Welcome to HTML");
    }
    finally {
      System.out.println("The finally clause is executed");
    }
  }
}

choices.label: B
choices.text: Welcome to Java followed by The finally clause is executed in the next line.

choices.label: C
choices.text: The program displays three lines: Welcome to Java, Welcome to HTML, The finally clause is executed.

questions.text:
What is displayed on the console when running the following program?

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    try {
      System.out.println("Welcome to Java");
      int i = 0;
      int y = 2 / i;
      System.out.println("Welcome to Java");
    }
    catch (RuntimeException ex) {
      System.out.println("Welcome to Java");
    }
    finally {
      System.out.println("End of the block");
    }
  }
}

choices.label: A
choices.text: The program displays Welcome to Java three times followed by End of the block.

choices.label: B
choices.text: The program displays Welcome to Java two times followed by End of the block.

choices.label: C
choices.text: The program displays Welcome to Java three times.

choices.label: D
choices.text: The program displays Welcome to Java two times.

questions.text:
What is displayed on the console when running the following program?

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    try {
      System.out.println("Welcome to Java");
      int i = 0;
      int y = 2 / i;
      System.out.println("Welcome to Java");
    }
    catch (RuntimeException ex) {
      System.out.println("Welcome to Java");
    }
    finally {
      System.out.println("End of the block");
    }
   
    System.out.println("End of the block");
  }
}

choices.label: A
choices.text: The program displays Welcome to Java three times followed by End of the block.

choices.label: B
choices.text: The program displays Welcome to Java two times followed by End of the block.

choices.label: C
choices.text: The program displays Welcome to Java two times followed by End of the block two times.

questions.text:
What is displayed on the console when running the following program?

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    try {
      System.out.println("Welcome to Java");
      int i = 0;
      int y = 2 / i;
      System.out.println("Welcome to Java");
    }
    finally {
      System.out.println("End of the block");
    }
   
    System.out.println("End of the block");
  }
}

choices.label: A
choices.text: The program displays Welcome to Java three times followed by End of the block.

choices.label: B
choices.text: The program displays Welcome to Java two times followed by End of the block.

choices.label: C
choices.text: The program displays Welcome to Java two times followed by End of the block two times.

choices.label: D
choices.text: The program displays Welcome to Java and End of the block, and then terminates because of an unhandled exception.

questions.text: Which of the following is not an advantage of Java exception handling?

choices.label: A
choices.text: Java separates exception handling from normal processing tasks.

choices.label: C
choices.text: Exception handling makes it possible for the caller's caller to handle the exception.

choices.label: D
choices.text: Exception handling simplifies programming because the error-reporting and error-handling code can be placed at the catch block.

questions.text:
Analyze the following code:

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    try {
      int zero = 0;
      int y = 2 / zero;
      try {
        String s = "5.6";
        Integer.parseInt(s); // Cause a NumberFormatException
      }
      catch(Exception e) {
      }
    }
    catch(RuntimeException e) {
      System.out.println(e);
    }
  }
}

choices.label: A
choices.text: A try-catch block cannot be embedded inside another try-catch block.

choices.label: B
choices.text: A good programming practice is to avoid nesting try-catch blocks, because nesting makes programs difficult to read. You can rewrite the program using only one try-catch block.

choices.label: C
choices.text: The program has a compile error because Exception appears before RuntimeException.

questions.text:
What is displayed on the console when running the following program?

public class Test {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    try {
      method();
      System.out.println("After the method call");
    }
    catch (RuntimeException ex) {
      System.out.println("RuntimeException");
    }
    catch (Exception ex) {
      System.out.println("Exception");
    }
  }

  static void method() throws Exception {
    try {
      String s = "5.6";
      Integer.parseInt(s); // Cause a NumberFormatException

      int i = 0;
      int y = 2 / i;
      System.out.println("Welcome to Java");
    }
    catch (NumberFormatException ex) {
      System.out.println("NumberFormatException");
      throw ex;
    }
    catch (RuntimeException ex) {
      System.out.println("RuntimeException");
    }
  }
}

choices.label: B
choices.text: The program displays NumberFormatException followed by After the method call.

choices.label: C
choices.text: The program displays NumberFormatException followed by RuntimeException.

choices.label: D
choices.text: The program has a compile error.

questions.text: What are the reasons to create an instance of the File class? Please select all that apply.

choices.label: A
choices.text: To determine whether the file exists.

choices.label: B
choices.text: To obtain the properties of the file such as whether the file can be read, written, or is hidden.

choices.label: E
choices.text: To read/write data from/to a file

questions.text: Which of the following is used to test if a file c:\temp\test.txt exists?
Which of the following statements creates an instance of File in Windows for the file c:\temp.txt?
Which of the following statements are true?

choices.label: A
choices.text: If a file (e.g., c:\temp.txt) does not exist, new File("c:\\temp.txt") returns null.

choices.label: B
choices.text: If a directory (e.g., c:\liang) does not exist, new File("c:\liang") returns null.

choices.label: C
choices.text: If a file (e.g., c:\temp.txt) does not exist, new File("c:\\temp.txt") creates a new file named c:\temp.txt.

choices.label: D
choices.text: If a directory (e.g., c:\liang) does not exist, new File("c:\liang") creates a new directory named c:\liang.

questions.text: Which class do you use to write data into a text file?
Which method can be used to write data?
Which method can be used to create an output object for file temp.txt? Please select all that apply.
Which class contains the method for checking whether a file exists?

Which of the following statements are correct? Please select all that apply.

I: 
try (PrintWriter output = new PrintWriter("output.txt");) {
  output.println("Welcome to Java");
}

II: 
try (PrintWriter output = new PrintWriter("output.txt");
     Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);) {
  output.println(input.nextLine());
}

III: 
PrintWriter output;
try (output = new PrintWriter("output.txt");) {
  output.println("Welcome to Java");
}

IV: 
try (PrintWriter output = new PrintWriter("output.txt");) {
  output.println("Welcome to Java");
}
finally {
  output.close();
}
Which class do you use to read data from a text file?
Which method can be used to read a whole line from the file?

Which of the following statements are correct?

I: 
File file = new File("input.txt");
try (Scanner input = new Scanner(file);) {
  String line = input.nextLine();
}

II: 
try (File file = new File("input.txt");
     Scanner input = new Scanner(file);) {
  String line = input.nextLine();
}

III: 
File file;
try (file = new File("input.txt");
     Scanner input = new Scanner(file);) {
  String line = input.nextLine();
}

IV: 
File file;
Scanner input;
try (file = new File("input.txt");
     input = new Scanner(file);) {
  String line = input.nextLine();
}
Which method can be used to create an input object for file temp.txt?

Suppose you enter 34.3 57.8 789, then press the ENTER key. Analyze the following code.

Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
int v1 = input.nextInt();
int v2 = input.nextInt();
String line = input.nextLine();

choices.label: A
choices.text: After the last statement is executed, v1 is 34.

choices.label: B
choices.text: The program has a runtime error because 34.3 is not an integer.

choices.label: C
choices.text: After the last statement is executed, line contains characters '7', '8', '9', '\n'.

choices.label: D
choices.text: After the last statement is executed, line contains characters '7', '8', '9'.

questions.text:
Suppose you enter 34.3 57.8 789, then press the ENTER key. Analyze the following code.

Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
double v1 = input.nextDouble();
double v2 = input.nextDouble();
String line = input.nextLine();

choices.label: A
choices.text: After the last statement is executed, line contains characters '7', '8', '9'.

choices.label: B
choices.text: After the last statement is executed, line contains characters '7', '8', '9', '\n'.

choices.label: C
choices.text: After the last statement is executed, line contains characters ' ', '7', '8', '9', '\n'.

choices.label: D
choices.text: After the last statement is executed, line contains characters ' ', '7', '8', '9'.

questions.text:
Suppose you enter 34.3, the ENTER key, 57.8, the ENTER key. Analyze the following code. Please select all that apply.

Line 1  Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
Line 2  double v1 = input.nextDouble();  
Line 3  double v2 = input.nextDouble();
Line 4  String line = input.nextLine();

choices.label: A
choices.text: After line 2 is executed, v1 is 34.3.

choices.label: B
choices.text: After line 3 is executed, v2 is 57.8.

choices.label: C
choices.text: After line 4 is executed, line contains an empty string.

choices.label: D
choices.text: After line 4 is executed, line is null.

choices.label: E
choices.text: After line 4 is executed, line contains character "\n".

questions.text:
Suppose you enter 34.3, the ENTER key, 57.8, the ENTER key, abc, the Enter key. Analyze the following code. Please select all that apply.

Line 1  Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
Line 2  double v1 = input.nextDouble();  
Line 3  double v2 = input.nextDouble();
Line 4  String line = input.nextLine();

choices.label: A
choices.text: After line 2 is executed, v1 is 34.3.

choices.label: B
choices.text: After line 3 is executed, v2 is 57.8.

choices.label: C
choices.text: After line 4 is executed, line contains an empty string.

choices.label: D
choices.text: After line 4 is executed, line is null.

choices.label: E
choices.text: After line 4 is executed, line contains character "abc".

questions.text: To create an InputStream to read from a file on a Web server, you use the method __________ in the URL class.
